task_description: Expand the template library from 15 to 30+ proven templates covering more categories: Questions, Predictions, Unpopular Opinions, Case Studies, Before/After, Lessons Learned, Tool Reviews. Templates are a key differentiator that provide immediate value and teach users what works.

patterns.template_object_structure: Templates follow a strict TypeScript interface with id (kebab-case with category prefix), name, category, template (with {placeholder} syntax), placeholders array, expectedScore tuple [min, max], bestWith media types array, and optional example field
patterns.placeholder_pattern: Template strings use {placeholder} syntax, each placeholder must have matching entry in placeholders array with key and hint
patterns.category_labels: categoryLabels object maps category slugs to display names (e.g., 'contrarian' -> 'Contrarian Takes')
patterns.score_ranges: expectedScore is [min, max] tuple, realistic ranges: contrarian 65-85, questions 70-85, value 60-75, stories 75-90

existing_implementations.description: Current template system has 15 templates across 9 categories (contrarian: 2, list: 2, story: 2, thread: 1, poll: 1, value: 2, question: 2, milestone: 1, teaching: 2)
existing_implementations.template_interface: Template { id: string, name: string, category: TemplateCategory, template: string, placeholders: Placeholder[], expectedScore: [number, number], bestWith: MediaType[], example?: string }
